questions.question: Where in Isaiah can you find the prophecy about a voice crying out in the wilderness?
Which chapters in both Zechariah and Malachi discuss God's promise to send a messenger?
Where do both Isaiah and Jeremiah prophesy about the new heavens and the new earth?
Identify the verses in Zechariah and Malachi that predict the coming of Elijah before the great day of the Lord.
In which passages do both Hosea and Micah lament the corruption of Israel's leaders?
Where do Isaiah and Ezekiel describe the sin of idolatry committed by Israel?
Which chapters in Daniel and Jeremiah include visions of restoration after calamity?
Identify the verses in Isaiah and Zephaniah that promise peace for the faithful.
Where do Nahum and Habakkuk describe the Lord's judgment on the wicked and deliverance for his people?
Which chapters in Malachi and Zechariah talk about refining and purifying the priesthood?
Identify the verses in Hosea and Amos where God expresses his desire for mercy rather than sacrifice.
Where do both Ezekiel and Jeremiah prophesy about the future reign of a Davidic king who will bring justice and righteousness?
Where is the prediction that a shoot will come up from the stump of Jesse, signifying a new leader from David's lineage?
Identify where it is said that God will make a covenant of peace with His people, turning the wild animals from the land so they can live safely in the wilderness and sleep in the woods.
Find where the Lord proclaims that He will send His messenger to prepare the way before Him, immediately before the Lord seeks His temple.
Where does the prophet describe a vision of a man with a measuring line, coming to measure Jerusalem?
In which passage does the prophet lament over his inadequate condition to see God, yet is touched by a burning coal that cleanses his sin?
Where is it written that God's thoughts and ways are higher than ours, as the heavens are higher than the earth?
Find the prophecy where it states that the Messiah would be pierced for our transgressions, crushed for our iniquities, and by His wounds we are healed.
Where does the prophet warn that a day of the Lord is coming, bringing darkness instead of light, as if a man fled from a lion and met a bear?
Identify the chapter and verse that discuss the rebuilding of the temple where the latter glory of the house will be greater than the former.
Where is it prophesied that Bethlehem, though small among the clans of Judah, will produce a ruler over Israel whose origins are from of old?
Where is the teaching that 'a little child shall lead them' found, referring to a time of peace among all creatures?
Identify where the verse is that speaks about God creating new heavens and a new earth, where former things will not be remembered.
Where does it state that the Messiah would be born in Bethlehem Ephrathah, which is too little to be among the clans of Judah?
Find the verse where it is said that 'they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruning hooks.'
Where is it prophesied that the sun shall be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the great and awesome day of the Lord comes?
In which verse is it declared that 'my house shall be called a house of prayer for all peoples'?
Where does the Lord say, 'I have loved you with an everlasting love; therefore I have continued my faithfulness to you'?
Which verse states that 'from the rising of the sun to its setting my name will be great among the nations'?
Identify the verse where it mentions that the Lord will shake the heavens and the earth and overthrow the throne of kingdoms.
Where is it written that 'the wolf and the lamb shall graze together, and the lion shall eat straw like the ox'?
Where is the prophecy that mentions a root of Jesse will stand as a signal for the peoples?
Identify the passage that describes the Lord's house being established as the highest of the mountains, exalted above the hills.
In which chapter and verse does it mention that the sun will no longer be your light by day, nor for brightness will the moon give light to you?
Where does it state that every pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the Lord of hosts?
Find the verse where it is written that the Lord will extend peace to her like a river, and the glory of the nations like an overflowing stream.
Identify the chapter and verse that discusses the vision of a man with a measuring line in his hand, coming to measure Jerusalem.
Where is the lament that even though the fig tree does not blossom and there is no fruit on the vines, the speaker will still rejoice in the Lord?
Which passage states that the Lord's voice cries to the city and it is sound wisdom to fear His name?
In what verses does it mention that from them shall come songs of thanksgiving, and the sound of revelers?
Where is it prophesied that a covenant of peace will not be removed, and the afflicted ones will be sheltered in peace?
Find the chapter and verse that describes the heavens being rolled up like a scroll, and all their host falling as leaves fall from the vine.
Which verse states that the Lord will again comfort Zion and will again choose Jerusalem?
Where does it say that the Lord has sworn by his right hand and his mighty arm that he will not again give your grain as food for your enemies?
Identify the passage where it is mentioned that the Redeemer will come to Zion, to those in Jacob who turn from transgression.
Which verse describes the mourning in Jerusalem being like the mourning for Hadad-rimmon in the plain of Megiddo?
Where is it prophesied that silver and gold will not be able to deliver on the day of the wrath of the Lord?
Identify where it says that God's spirit is poured out from on high, and the wilderness becomes a fruitful field.
Which chapter and verse discuss that the Lord will take away the chariots from Ephraim and the warhorses from Jerusalem?
Where does it mention that the heart of the people has grown dull, and with their ears they can barely hear, and their eyes they have closed?
Find the chapter and verse that says the house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau stubble.
Where is it prophesied that out of Egypt, God called His son?
Identify the passage that speaks of the voice of one calling to clear the way for the Lord in the wilderness.
In which chapter and verse is it declared that the glory of Lebanon shall be given to it, the majesty of Carmel and Sharon?
Find the verse where God declares that He will make justice the measuring line and righteousness the plumb line.
Where does it mention that the Lord will whistle for the fly that is at the ends of the streams of Egypt, and for the bee that is in the land of Assyria?
Which chapter and verse discuss that the root of Jesse will come, and he who arises to rule over the nations, in him shall the Gentiles hope?
Identify where it says that every warrior's boot used in battle and every garment rolled in blood will be burned as fuel for the fire.
Where is the divine announcement that Jerusalem will be told that her warfare is ended, and her iniquity is pardoned?
In what verses does it state that the Spirit of the Lord will not depart from them, and the words that He has put in their mouth will not depart?
Find the chapter and verse that describes a future time when Tyre will be forgotten for seventy years, like the days of one king, before singing as a prostitute.
Where does it say that the precious sons of Zion, comparable to fine gold, how they are regarded as earthen pots?
Which verse states that the Lord roars from Zion and utters his voice from Jerusalem, and the heavens and the earth quake?
Identify the chapter and verse that predicts that the sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the great and awesome day of the Lord comes.
Where is it written that the Lord will bring again the captivity of his people Israel and Judah and will restore them to the land He gave to their fathers?
Which chapter and verse discuss the statement that the Lord is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble; He knows those who take refuge in him?
Identify where it says that the Lord will restore the fortunes of his people Israel, and they shall rebuild the ruined cities and inhabit them.
Where is it prophesied that from Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem?
Find where it is mentioned that the wolf and the lamb shall dwell together, and the leopard shall lie down with the young goat.
Which verse describes seeing the tents of Cushan in affliction, and the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble?
Where is it described that the new wine dries up and the vine languishes?
Identify where the passage speaks of selling a righteous man for silver and a needy man for a pair of sandals.
In which chapter and verse is it stated that the Lord has blotted out your transgressions like a cloud and your sins like mist?
Find the verse where it is declared that the Lord will fight against those nations as when he fights on a day of battle.
Where does it mention that they shall not hurt or destroy in all God's holy mountain?
Which chapter and verse discuss that Jerusalem shall be called the Throne of the Lord, and all nations shall gather to it?
Identify where it says that before they call, I will answer; while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
In what verses does it state that the Lord will turn the valley of trouble into a door of hope?
Where is it written that the Lord will make the lame a remnant, and the outcasts a strong nation?
Which chapter and verse discuss the statement that the Lord is slow to anger but great in power, and will not at all acquit the wicked?
Identify where it says that a fountain shall come forth from the house of the Lord and shall water the valley of Shittim.
In which chapter and verse is it mentioned that the Lord will take vengeance on his adversaries and keeps wrath for his enemies?
Where is the declaration that the light of the moon will be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be sevenfold, as the light of seven days?
Find the verse that describes the Lord standing and measuring the earth, seeing and driving asunder the nations.
Which verse states that the mountains quake before Him, the hills melt, and the earth heaves at His presence?
Identify where it says that the Lord will restore the fortunes of the tents of Jacob and have compassion on his dwellings.
Where does it mention that the earth will disclose her blood and no more cover her slain?
In what verses does it declare that the sower shall overtake the reaper, and the treader of grapes him who sows the seed?
Find where it is written that those who are far off shall come and build in the temple of the Lord.
Which verse describes the Lord's rebuke to the sea, making it dry, and drying up all the rivers?
Where is the metaphor of a potter's clay used to describe God's sovereignty over nations?
Identify the passage that compares the judgment of God to a refiner's fire.
Where is the lament over the destruction of the vineyard that produced only wild grapes?
In which chapters do both Isaiah and Jeremiah prophesy the new covenant where the law is written on hearts?
Which verse states that Israel has sold themselves for nothing, and shall be redeemed without money?
Where does the text describe a vision of dry bones coming to life?
Identify where it mentions that the sun will be turned to darkness and the moon into blood before the great day of the Lord.
Which passage describes a feast of rich food and well-aged wine on God's holy mountain?
Find the prophecy where Egypt will speak the language of Canaan and swear allegiance to the Lord.
Where is it prophesied that daughters of Jerusalem are like booths in a vineyard, like a besieged city?
Which chapter and verse describe a coming ruler from Bethlehem, who is to be ruler in Israel?
Identify where the description of a righteous Branch who will execute justice and righteousness in the land can be found.
Where does Ezekiel prophesy the unification of the sticks of Judah and Joseph?
Which verse predicts the fall of the king of Tyre using the metaphor of a fallen cherub?
In which chapter and verse is the mourning in Jerusalem compared to the mourning at Hadad-rimmon in the plain of Megiddo?
Where is it stated that the people who walked in darkness have seen a great light?
Identify where the rebuilding of the temple is described, with the glory of this latter house promised to be greater than the former.
Which verse speaks of the Lord commanding peace to the far and to the near?
Find where it says that the Lord will remove the reproach of His people from all the earth.
Where does Jeremiah foretell the writing of a new covenant not like the one made with their fathers?
Which chapter and verse describe the Lord as a refiner's fire and like fuller's soap?
Identify where the phrase 'But let justice roll down like waters, and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream' is located.
Where is the description of God's call to 'remove the filthy garments from him', referring to Joshua the high priest?
Which passage states that the Lord's words are flawless, like silver purified in a crucible?
Find the chapter and verse where it says that the lion shall eat straw like the ox.
Where does Isaiah describe a time when no resident will say, 'I am sick'; the people who dwell there will be forgiven their iniquity?
Which verse predicts that a man shall be as a hiding place from the wind and a covert from the tempest?
Identify where it is stated that the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf unstopped.
Find the prophecy that speaks of beating swords into plowshares and spears into pruning hooks.
Where is the vision of a highway called the Way of Holiness, where the unclean shall not pass over it?
Which chapter and verse describe the day of the Lord being darkness, and not light?
Identify where God promises that a nation that does not serve Israel will perish; those nations shall be utterly wasted.
Where is the prophecy that a virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and shall call his name Immanuel?
Which chapter and verse describe the Lord standing upon the altar and striking the capitals until the thresholds shake?
Find where it is written that the Lord roars from Zion, and utters His voice from Jerusalem, and the heavens and the earth quake.
Where does it mention that the Lord will be king over all the earth; on that day the Lord will be one and his name one?
Which verse says that the Lord will swallow up death forever, and will wipe away tears from all faces?
Identify where the rebuilding of ruined cities is foretold, where they shall plant vineyards and drink their wine, and make gardens and eat their fruit.
Where is it prophesied that the wolf and the lamb shall graze together, and the lion shall eat straw like the ox?
Which chapter and verse describe God's spirit being poured out on all flesh, and sons and daughters prophesying?
Find the declaration that though the fig tree should not blossom, nor fruit be on the vines, the faithful will still rejoice in the Lord.
Where does it state that the house of David shall be like God, like the angel of the Lord, going before them?
Which verse predicts that every pot in Jerusalem and Judah shall be holy to the Lord of hosts?
Identify where it mentions that all your sons shall be taught by the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children.
Find where the Lord says that He has blotted out your transgressions like a cloud and your sins like mist, urging to return to Him.
Where is the metaphor of a vineyard that produced wild grapes used to symbolize the people of Israel and their corrupt deeds?
Where does Isaiah prophesy about the peaceable kingdom where the wolf will dwell with the lamb?
Identify where Malachi speaks about the messenger who will prepare the way before the Lord.
In which verse does Isaiah describe a king who will reign in righteousness?
Where is the vision of the new heavens and the new earth first described by Isaiah?
Which passage in Malachi discusses God's judgment coming suddenly to His temple?
Find where Zechariah prophesies that many nations will join themselves to the Lord in that day and become His people.
Where does Isaiah proclaim that the glory of Lebanon shall be given to it, the majesty of Carmel and Sharon?
In which chapter does Isaiah foretell the coming of a ruler who shall be a hiding place from the wind and a cover from the tempest?
Identify the passage where Isaiah uses the metaphor of a vineyard to illustrate Israel's relationship with God.
Where does Malachi warn of a coming day burning like an oven, when all the arrogant and evildoers will be stubble?
Which passage in Zechariah describes the future king of Zion coming humble and mounted on a donkey?
Find where Micah states that the Messiah will be born in Bethlehem Ephrathah, who is to be ruler in Israel.
Where does Isaiah speak of the anointed one who brings good news and binds up the brokenhearted?
Which verse in Malachi discusses the refinement of Levites, purifying them like gold and silver?
Identify where Isaiah describes a feast for all peoples, a banquet of aged wine and rich food full of marrow.
In which passage does Zechariah prophesy the removal of iniquity in a single day?
Where does Isaiah predict that Egypt and Assyria will worship together with Israel, blessed in the midst of the earth by the Lord?
Find where Malachi calls for tithes and offerings to be brought into the storehouse, promising that the Lord will open the windows of heaven.
Which verse in Zechariah speaks of a future time when every pot in Jerusalem and Judah will be holy to the Lord?
Where does Isaiah describe the Lord's servant, who acts wisely and will be high and lifted up, and very exalted?
